snippet: Some employers are offering as many as 25 health care plans to employees from a variety of insurers, including Blue Cross and UnitedHealthcare, to lower their costs for the benefit.
abstract: Companies nationwide are embracing number of new strategies to combat rising health care costs, including private insurance exchanges that can offer employees wide array of plans to choose from.
lead_paragraph: Some employers are offering as many as 25 health care plans to employees from a variety of insurers, including Blue Cross and UnitedHealthcare, to lower their costs for the benefit.

headline.main: Companies Test Plans to Cut Their Health Costs
headline.print_headline: Companies Test Plans to Cut Their Health Costs

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
